title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: It was good. They make you feel comfortable. I'm not exactly sure how they weigh students based on their achievements. Moreover, why is the minimum eligibility NET exam when they have to select someone highly qualified?
Interview Questions: Tell me about the economy of Uttar Pradesh

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: Good and it was easy. The person who took my interview was friendly and helped me throughout the interview, if I wasn’t able to answer the question by giving hints.
Interview Questions: Simple and basic questions of biology

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 6-7 people ask questions on the subject and research area. Genuine and good questions. Takes around full day and need patience for your turn . Interviews are first cum first basis
Interview Questions: Describe market structure and perfect competition

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Walk-in, based on minimum eligibility i.e. masters and NET national eligibility test. Given some preferences for Ph.D. holders and candidates having publications in good journals. In the interview panel, there are generally 4 panelists, a college principal, the head of a respective department, two subject experts
Interview Questions:
Introduction
Subject-specific questions
Questions related to Ph.D. and related to teaching experience

title: Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: So after clearing an entrance exam you need to give a interview before a panel of 5-6 teachers. They will ask you more about academics and research. First they will ask you about your interest then they will ask from the topic you have mentioned to them. So prepared well a single subject
Interview Questions: basic life sciences questions they had asked.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: Questions and answers for minimum 15 minutes along with a presentation round and if needed questions on past experience. Any research experience is also seemed ans inquired about from time to time.
Interview Questions: How will you teach the students in Hindi!?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Delhi in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: online assessment containing easy  medium level aptitude and one coding question  followed by two technical interviews (project discussion , dsa questions,cs fundamentals like oops concepts, sql querries, threads, udp vs tcp and so on.) and a HR round.
Interview Questions:
1) detect cycle in a linked list
2) what is hash map and its implementation

title: Assistant Professor, Economics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: Process was smooth and timely . Candidates were asked area of specialization. Questions pertaining to basic macro and micreconomics were common in most cases. It's good to prepare in advance at least one subject to feel confident.
Interview Questions:
1. Explain implications of fiscal expansion on private investment.
2. Explain j-curve.
3. Cash transfers versus subsidies

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions:
Very deliberately asked questions related to the post you were applying. Key concepts clarity and time management skills were important for hiring for the post in that interview.
They quizzed me by asking questions about my hobbies and passion, i remained calm and confident throughout nonetheless.
Interview Questions: Describe what did you learn in your phd

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extremely tough and competitive. The aspirant must be thorough with their subject. They look for quality and research. Make sure that you have a minimum of two publications.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this career?

title: Associate Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Excellent, anonymous, great, proficient, enjoyable, gracious, interactive, knowledge gain, profit basis, salary improvement, post improvement, high standard quality, quality questions, managable price, minimum preparation, quality time spent, curiosity, amazing, can be given again, good company, dream company, prolonged
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Junior Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: from the date of applying to the actual interview date, it took roughly 3-4 months. interview was smooth and I received the offer the same day. the overall process was quite smooth.
Interview Questions: research related questions

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: Easy, straight, related to papers of candidate's interest and comfort, some current affairs , at times problem solving some current affairs , at times problem solving some current affairs , at times problem solving
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor Economics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: 10 minute interview for adhoc position followed by a small demo lecture.There was also different questions asked. They were checking in depth knowledge of econometrics and time series. The panel consist of four members.
Interview Questions: Econometrics and time series

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Delhi
Interview Descriptions: There is a viva voce and they ask you general questions depending on the background of your studies. Basic knowledge should be there accompanied by the previous research project you worked on.
Interview Questions: How many types of non coding RNAs are there?

title: Design Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1.Asked for introduction
2.asked about the  portfolio
portfolio  speaks a lot. They  wanted  to  know  about  design skills of  person   in  corresponding  product  design  department.So  portfolio  must  be  prepared accordingly based  on  requirement
3.Asked  about  certain machining operations carried out in department
Interview Questions: 1.Asked for introduction

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Delhi in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Letter of grading explanation (hard copy)
? Possibility to graduate (BA4 only) (hard copy)
? Academic degree and certified copy (hard copy, after graduation day in August only)
? Diploma certificate (electronic, after passing the whole study programme only)
? Diploma supplements (electronic, after graduation day in August only)
? Credit certificates (electronic)
? Ranking in the cohort (electronic)
Interview Questions: Letter of grading explanation (hard copy)

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: questions ranging from subject knowledge to current progress in the field were asked.  faculty you wish to choose was also asked and questions related to field of research of that professor were also asked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want join here?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It seem easy to they ask some previous year qualification then afterwards , he ask some questions regarding my hobbies and interest, also they have to qualify me to get in admission in college
Interview Questions: they ask me about my hobbies and interest also they want to know about my qualifications

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Questions are mostly asked from the subjects which you have previously taught or you claim expertise in. Depends mostly on the interviewer. There is a panel of experts. Also, questions are asked from your research area. Language skills are highly valued. Number of people applying is high as DU being a much coveted central university and this makes it a tough call.
Interview Questions: Asked question about my PhD, its progress and findings.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: No specific questions. Very general.... Thye asked few questions on my subject specialisation. It's more about the marks you secure and the ranking would have been already done of the candidates based on it. It's a central university and hence they have protocols to follow as to how they would select candidates.
Interview Questions: About why DU?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was just one face to face round with the management committee. With all the senior staff and they just wanted a confident candidate with good knowledge about the requisite softwares.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you face any problem?

title: Adhoc Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process, asked about basic questions of computer science. Subjects covered were operating systems, computer networks, software engineering, database management systems, unix network programming and object oriented principles.
Interview Questions: what is SDLC

title: Bachelor of Elementary Education (B El Ed) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi)
Interview Descriptions: Entrance Exam and Interview of selected candidates that pass the entrance exam. afterwords, counselling of selected candidates that pass the interview. finally admission into the B.El.Ed course (i.e, of 4 years)
Interview Questions: Why you would like to become a teacher?

title: Junior Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Delhi (New Delhi) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: There was just a typing test and i was called accordingly when the seat was vacant
Interview Questions: Typing speed
